availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George W. Doneghy (Boyle County, Kentucky, Sheriff)

body.p: Boyle County, Kentucky, sheriff. Michigan Territory native. Trustee of Common School in District 21 in Boyle County, Kentucky in 1856. Sheriff in Boyle County, Kentucky in 1862. Owned one enslaved person in Boyle County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, Danville, p. 843.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, p. 19.
Find A Grave, "George W. Doneghy (Jan. 25, 1800-Jun. 2, 1865)," Memorial #60006139, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/60006139 (accessed April 15, 2020).
"The Common School,"The Kentucky Tribune(Danville, Ky.), May 30, 1856, p. 3.
